alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Manitowoc; Marathon; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 30 at 9:04PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow to Bring Slippery Roads for the Tuesday Morning Commute... A strong storm system will bring the first widespread accumulating snow of the season to central and east-central Wisconsin late tonight into Tuesday morning. 1 to 3 inches of snow can be expected by midday Tuesday. Light to moderate snow is expected to spread into central Wisconsin around 2 to 4 am and into the Fox Valley around 4 to 6 am. The accumulating snow should taper off at most locations during the late morning or early afternoon. The timing of the snow suggests that it will impact the morning commute. 1 to 2 inches of snow may already have fallen over central WI by 7 am and the higher snowfall rates will be approaching the Fox Valley during the peak of the morning commute. The snow will likely create slippery roads across central Wisconsin and the Fox Valley late tonight into Tuesday morning. Be sure to use caution on your commute in the morning, and allow yourself extra time to reach your destination.
